title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (https://contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available https://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/.

title: Contributing to grex
text: suggest change via pull requests, please: Fork repository GitHub account. Clone forked repository local machine, make changes. Commit push changes GitHub. Create pull request.

title: Gene ID Mapping for Genotype-Tissue Expression (GTEx) Data
text: Genotype-Tissue Expression (GTEx) project (Lonsdale et al. 2013) aims measuring human tissue-specific gene expression levels. collected data, able explore landscape gene expression, gene regulation, deep connections genetic variations. Raw GTEx data contains expression measurements various types elements (genes, pseudogenes, noncoding DNA sequences) covering whole genome. analysis, might desirable keep subset data, example, data protein coding genes. cases, mapping original Ensembl gene IDs Entrez gene IDs HGNC symbols become essential step analysis pipeline. grex offers minimal dependency solution ID mappings. Currently, Ensembl ID GTEx can mapped Entrez gene ID, HGNC gene symbol, UniProt ID, basic annotation information HGNC gene name, cytogenetic location, gene type. also limit scope Ensembl IDs appeared gene read count data. Ensembl IDs transcript data considered future versions.

title: Gene ID Mapping for Genotype-Tissue Expression (GTEx) Data
text: facilitate ID conversion tasks, grex package built-mapping table derived well-known annotation data package org.Hs.eg.db (Carlson 2015). mapping data used integrated mapping information Ensembl NCBI, maximize possibility finding matched Entrez ID. R script creating mapping table located . surprisingly, creating table, hundreds cases single Ensembl ID can mapped multiple Entrez gene IDs. create one--one mapping, took simple approach: just removed duplicated Entrez IDs kept first encountered original database. Therefore, might cases mapping 100% accurate. doubts particular results, please try searching original ID Ensembl website see got correct mapped ID.

title: Gene ID Mapping for Genotype-Tissue Expression (GTEx) Data
text: example, use Ensembl IDs GTEx V7 gene count data select 100 IDs: elements mapped accurately NA. Genes mapped Entrez ID: want start raw GENCODE gene IDs provided GTEx (e.g.¬†ENSG00000227232.4), function cleanid() can help remove .version part , produce Ensembl IDs.
code: library("grex") data("gtexv7") id <- gtexv7[101:200] df <- grex(id) tail(df) #>          ensembl_id entrez_id hgnc_symbol                                   hgnc_name #> 95  ENSG00000266075      <NA>        <NA>                                        <NA> #> 96  ENSG00000272153      <NA>        <NA>                                        <NA> #> 97  ENSG00000116198      9731      CEP104                     centrosomal protein 104 #> 98  ENSG00000169598      1677        DFFB       DNA fragmentation factor subunit beta #> 99  ENSG00000198912    339448    C1orf174         chromosome 1 open reading frame 174 #> 100 ENSG00000236423 100133612   LINC01134 long intergenic non-protein coding RNA 1134 #>     cyto_loc uniprot_id   gene_biotype #> 95      <NA>       <NA>           <NA> #> 96      <NA>       <NA>           <NA> #> 97   1p36.32     O60308 protein_coding #> 98   1p36.32     B4DZS0 protein_coding #> 99   1p36.32     Q8IYL3 protein_coding #> 100  1p36.32       <NA>        lincRNA filtered_genes <-   df[     !is.na(df$"entrez_id"),     c("ensembl_id", "entrez_id", "hgnc_symbol", "gene_biotype")   ] head(filtered_genes) #>        ensembl_id entrez_id hgnc_symbol         gene_biotype #> 1 ENSG00000162576     54587       MXRA8       protein_coding #> 2 ENSG00000175756     54998    AURKAIP1       protein_coding #> 4 ENSG00000221978     81669       CCNL2       protein_coding #> 5 ENSG00000224870    148413  MRPL20-AS1 processed_transcript #> 6 ENSG00000242485     55052      MRPL20       protein_coding #> 8 ENSG00000235098    441869     ANKRD65       protein_coding

title: Gene ID Mapping for Genotype-Tissue Expression (GTEx) Data
text: Conventionally, next step removing (imputing) genes NA IDs, select genes keep. Notably, observed complete gene read count data, 100 cases, multiple Ensembl IDs can mapped one single Entrez ID. Post-processing steps may also needed genes.

title: Gene ID Mapping for Genotype-Tissue Expression (GTEx) Data ‚Äî grex
text: function returns data frame number rows length input Ensembl IDs, containing: ensembl_id - Input Ensembl ID entrez_id - Entrez Gene ID hgnc_symbol - HGNC gene symbol hgnc_name - HGNC gene name cyto_loc - Cytogenetic location uniprot_id - UniProt ID gene_biotype - Gene type elements mapped NA.

title: Gene ID Mapping for Genotype-Tissue Expression (GTEx) Data ‚Äî grex
